column9: gosh !! this is a wonderful treatment for me, now since using miralax my poo poo is no problem, easy, soft, i thought i had a growth in me, then my doctor did a xray, there it was old poop ( 8 pounds ) whew the first couple of movement were very stinky. but now i am normal and soft does not hurt and no straing. i love this stuff. one thing, testing to see what is the best time to take it in am ? evening ? or night ? i want to go in the morning and i want to go at home, not somewhere in public. but i do carry a air freshner in my purse until i get the timeing right. i surely do not want to be the talk at church. i would reccomend this to anyone. i have the lap band and i thought it was the manuplation causing this, but nope it's me and my age. i feel very young, but it's the age thing i am 48 and things are changing. i am also a nurse and i prayed i would never get fixated on my bowels, but i guess it happends anyway. i now understand when my patients used to say, yea, i had a good one ~ or i had one but it wasn't a good one. well using this miralax now i always have a good one haa ha. try it, i simply love it. no taste, works great for me.

column2: Former Educator, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had suffered from constipation all of my life.  As I aged, it became worse.  Finally, I told my doctor that I could not go on like this with passing little hard marbles as a stool. Oh, and you absolutely MUST drink plenty of liquids throughout the day.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My G.I. Dr. recommended I take 1 capful every day and have been doing this for 3/4 of a year. He says it is harmless for extended use. Have settled into 1 bm per day, but since there is a LOT of strong gas, it is difficult to do this in a public or workplace bathroom -- a definite problem that needs planning for every day. Have lately had a lot of sleepiness and a spacey feeling in my head -- might be electrolyte balance is off, or might be unrelated to Miralax. Wish I knew if extended use is really safe.

column9: Beware, this product works but can produce constant gas and bloating. Also, YOU MUST make sure that you mix it, THOROUGHLY side effects get worst. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I suffer with chronic constipation. The dr. told me to try Miralax and I was pleased with the ease of use & the way my body responded to it. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My experience has not been a good one with Miralax.  I've dealt with severe constipation for a long time now so my doc prescribed it for me.  It worked in the first few days and was very easy to put into my coffee/juice, but caused swelling of my face and ankles and feet.  I experimented with it to make sure it was he Miralax that was causing this, and it definitely was.  When I stopped taking it, the swelling went away.  The worst part was it made my stomach also swell to look as though I was pregnant.  I'm not sure why this happened other than Miralax is supposed to cause water to go into the colon to help with constipation, but I have been diagnosed with 'leaky gut syndrome' and think maybe this is how the water escaped from the colon and into everywhere else.  I've seen many blogs where it has worked wonders for lots, but think people with leaky gut should know this and try a different product.

column2: Melodie6, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: My 7 year old Grandson had been on Miralax for over 5 years for chronic constipation and mega colon problems. In the last 2 years he had become withdrawn and quiet and just not quite himself. We thought it was because of his bowel problem but also noticed learning problems surfacing, attention and not focusing. My daughter read on-line a post about Miralax being involved with side effects similar to the ways her son was acting, So she took him off the Miralax in August of 2010. When we saw them at Christmas, it was like seeing a new child! He was alert, out going, happy, attentive and focused. My daughter said he's doing very well in school and seems to have come out of his shell, so to speak. I notice a significant difference in him and believe the Miralax WAS causing him to act the way he was. They need to put more warnings on the bottle for long term use, longer than 2 months! Please do that, MIRALAX, and save these little ones from Permanant damage, as well as the elderly, that use this medication frequently and for long terms.

column9: I am a healthy (heretofore) 62 year old male, eat healthy, drink lots of water, exercise and avoid gluten entirely (due to intolerance) and sugar. I have had no pain meds, and therefore could not understand when I developed a serious digestion problem.Due to problem, gastroenterologist put me on MiraLax, a double dose. I took it for 4 months, and then started having bizarre, troubling thoughts very unlike myself, horrible pictures/day terrors including suicidal urges. I have been off Miralax for 10 days and am seeing an improvement, however the effects are not completely gone and nights are horrible. It has scared my wife for my safety, and in researching she found it listed on FDA as being watched for "neuro-psychiatric events". I realize there are few instances where it does this, however, one death is too many.  I have since found a recipe for an organic concoction that really works and am still seeing doctors to identify the problem with the digestion while using the fruit brew to help with chronic constipation, and it really takes care of it. I am wondering if anyone else has had psychiatric reactions/depression/suicidal thoughts while using  miralax.

column2: Laurie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Both my son and I are on this medication.  It is not habit forming as some people believe; you can take it when you need it.  In my opinion this is my miracle drug! Before I knew about this medicine it felt like I was passing ROCKS through my intestines and not stool softeners, laxatives or fiber drinks were effective They only made things worst with the horrible side effects.  Miralax has no side effects.  I mix it with a glass of orange juice and I drink half and my son drink the other half. I believe the reason children and adults alike have the problem of chronic constipation is because of our diets that are packed with so much unnatural chemicals and preservatives and OTC drug and prescription drugs that people take with a sip of liquid dehydrate our bodies. Also, If people drink soda then they are not getting enough water a day which adds to the constipation problem.  I know I have to remind my son to stop playing and go get a drink of water. Anyway, I've had this problem all my life and Miralax is the only thing that works.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: I have suffered from severe constipation ever since I was around three years old, without a real known cause. column2: marlynh325@aol.com, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Ela777, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Need some advice here..I don't know yet what I have, but all that I know now is that my symtoms began over a little over two years ago. My system had stopped working gradually. I would have a bowel moment, but then I couldn't finish. The bowel momemt would be incomplete. I figure, like everything else, my body would eventually fix itself without taking any medicines. Well, it didn't work & it eventually got worse. I guess me freaking out didn't help any. Up until now, I've have been healthy. I have never taking any medications at all. I'd barely take Advil for headaches, so dealing with this issue has turned my upside down taking everything from senekot to stool softeners to milk of magnesia. After tryin' them, I found that Milk of Magnesia works quickly, which I know it's not good for your system. I would go back & forth between Magnesia & stool softens, yet taking them every other day. Mind you, I'm not very consistent taking these meds, which probably could be my problem. Miralax has been "haunting" me to give to another try. When I tried it the first time, I felt so bad that I felt like I was dying; headache, heart beating fast, sweats, bloating. It did work a little, but I don't think I stuck with it long enough to be "my miracle" or drank enough water with it. I really & truly want Miralax to work for me 'cause I heard so many good things about it. I'm just scared to feel that same feeling from the last time, but something has to work better than what I'm doing. I know that this is not a "support group," but is there any way I can find an online support system for my health condition? Or to even start one?

column2: WebMD, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken this product each day for five days with absolutely no resulting movement.

column2: frankie, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Reason for taking was Constipation.  Doctor said I could take it forever.  I have taken it for a very long time and it worked fairly well but now I have some leaking around the annus not diarhea like put smearing soft stool.  Anyone else have this?

column2: TCOLE16, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son is almost 7 yrs old. He started using Miralax at the age of 2 1/2 yrs old because of constant constipation. It helped for a very short time. Then his constipation got worse. I kept taking him back to see his pediatrican and he advised me to keep using the Miralax, so I did. Last year, we switched pediatricians and his new pediatrician sent my son to see a pediatric gastroentronologist. They did test after test trying to find out why my son has been constantly constipated for 4 years. As it turns out, it was nothing really to do with him and his anatomy. I took him off the Miralax that he has taken everyday for the past 4 1/2 yrs, and now my son has absolutely no problem with the constipation anymore. The Miralax was the problem all along. I think it would be ok to use for a very short period of time, but I would NOT recommend use for any long periods of time. My poor boy went through alot of unnessisary hell because of this stuff!!!

column2: NavalGurl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Was prescribed Miralax by my Dr 2 substiture for large dosage of Senna (in combo w/ docusate sodium) I had been using 2 combat constipation associated w/ scar tissue & adheasions from Endometriosis & the fact that I am also on oral morphine for pain control. Additionally, I have GERD & a Thyroid condition. Had some relief w/ this product, but had 2 experiment w/ dosage levels & never got 1 that did not include diarrhea accidents combined w/ constipation. In 1 episode, it took nearly 3 wks to the day 2 have ANY movement at all & then it was several BMs cumulating in 24 hrs of diarrhea. During 4 months of using this product I experienced SEVERE cramping, bloating, nausea, dizziness, gas gurgling & stomach cramps so bad (reminding me of when I had colonitis) that I had 2 take 2 my bed w/ a heating pad on my stomach. Something I've not had 2 do since my Endo was active. In all the years I've had infrequent bowel movements, I NEVER experienced these types of stomach pains or cramping. I quit this product nearly 4 wks ago & went back 2 my previous regime, but w/ lower Senna dosage, & am still feeling like I have yet to get all the Miralax out of my system. Still have alternate days of nausea & stomach cramps. The gas gurgling has yet to stop. If I were employed right now I'd have been calling in sick more than 50% of the time. These side effects are considered "common" to "Infrequent", but in each case "less severe"; however, I agree w/ the Reviewer who stated they thought they would die. Unfortunately, the V.A. will not consider other products, such as Align, due to the expense. My previous regime had actually worked quite well, but I had asked my primary physician to prescribe the Senna (from the V.A.) as I could no longer afford it OTC. When she learned how much Senna I took (as recommended by the Pain Control Pharmacist), she switched me to the Miralax due to concerns about Senna's effect on the Heart. I will never touch this stuff again. Exceedlingly dissatisfied.

column2: trisha, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Overall, this is a great product.  Took over 4 days to begin working after being constipated for 5 days....but, now, it works like a dream. I did not experience any side effects.  Can't imagine what was going on inside me before I began taking this....  Now, it's a pleasure! And I've finally been able to lose weight!

column2: sherhere, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on Miralax for approx 2 yrs. It was like an OTC miracle. I have severe, painful impactions(or spontaneous evacuations). Miralax (Rx by DR)worked wonders. No more impactions and for those 2 years I felt almost 'normal'. Was no longer afraid to leave my home. Now it seems to be less effective...I am not having a 'daily' BM and I swear, I can smell Miralax when I perspire. I have trouble itching in my pelvic area.I've tried to solve the itching every way I know (stop other meds, etc. I'm taking pain meds and must have something or I'm back to the impactions!) I know I'm describing 'allergy' but if I stop Miralax,and have the insueing problems, I'm facing a colostomy or more years of being house-bound. Does anyone out there have any similar problems? Any solutions that work for you? I'm wondering what happens to our bodies when we take Miralax for a prolonged period of time.I've read bits and pieces about even removing salt from our brain!I would appreciate some feedback if you understand where I'm coming from.Thanks.
I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone who is suffering from chronic constipation...  have been using daily for over 2 years.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hi to everyone here, I used Miralax just about three or 4 times since 11/09, prescribed by my GI Doc. for IBS with Constipation.It didn't help much and the last time I used it, T. 11/23 in the evening, the next day, I was weak, dizzy, lightheaded.  I also had such serious chest pain in the eveing for over 45 min. while I was trying to cook, I was about to call an Ambulance to rule out a possible Heart Attack.I am now undergoing Cardiac Tests to make sure I don't have a Cardiac Problem.My GI Doc. doesn't think it was the Miralax, but since I stopped it, this - the serious chest pain has not re- occurred.Wondering if anybody else has experienced chest pain that bad.Thanks.J. Shea- NYC

column2: ogee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: When I first took it, it worked great.  I used it once for like 4 days, and then I could go for a whole month without taking more.  Then again I needed it another time.  I got so sick.  My stomach cramped up so bad, I thought I was gonna die. no lie.  Almost called emergencey room, but I held strong, and by the morning, the pain was done.  I went, but at what cost?  I promised myself I woudlnt eat anything ever again to avoid that pain,  but you know that is not possible.  I have to take it now for like 4 to five days straight to even get a movement, and then it only works for one day.  That miracle that happenned the forst time, Never aghian.  What is whith this stuff?  I'm confulsed.  I think it's the genereic form that is not working right.  One time I hit the end of a bottle once, I'll bet all the medicine dropped to the bottom, that was the time I almost went ot the emergency room.  I went, buyt man was it terrible experience.  I wish it worked like it did first time.  I just think my body is so sensitive to anything new, it get' s used to it so fast, and bang, never again.  I don;'t even use it much and still it wont' work like the first time.  I'm really confused.  anyone else have that happen to them?  I'm curious, so many of u seem to be so happy with it.  Tell me though.  How long do u have to take it for it to work, and how often do u take it.  ?  Is it something u take on a constant basis? Thanks .Constipation sucks.  Drink lots of water, lots, eat lots of veggies and fruit and no matter what, even if u do that n u on a lot of pain meds, forget about it, u in trouble like me.  Although when I also exercised on a regular I went better but not comfortably.

column2: mrrelief2010, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went online and started researching colon cleansing products and bought one that had a bottle of mixed herbs and another bottle with a fiber blend capsules. I got fair results while I used the product for 10 days. I increased my water and juices intake to help move things along. But after being off the colon cleanse for about a week, things were getting sluggish again. After another week I was back where I started before the colon cleansing program. After a few more weeks, my colon was blocked on the left side in the sigmoid colon region. I was cramped, very uncomfortable, sluggish and getting headaches. Things were stuck, so I called my doctor and left a message on his exchange that my colon was blocked and I didn't know what to do. In less than 5 minutes he returned the call and told me to describe my symptoms. He then told me to get to the pharmacy ASAP and pick up a small bottle of Miralax, a laxative I hadn't heard about. He told me it works differently than Metamucil or Ex-Lax, a tasteless powder, and it used to be a prescription product. He also told me GI specialists have patients use Miralax to cleanse the colon for colonoscopy.So Immediately I got to the pharmacy and picked up the Miralax, got home and poured a caps worth dose that I stirred into 1/2 glass of organic prune juice and 1/2 purified water. I drank it down, but honestly didn't think anything positive was going to happen. But that evening I got the bathroom urge and then a miracle happened. I had a massive comfortable cleansing and could literally feel the relief of the pressure in my left side where I was blocked up.I learned my lesson and went to the market and bought all fresh fruits and veges I could get in the car. For 3-4 days all I ate and drank were quarts of purified water, oatmeal with cooked apples, juices, salads, grapes, cherries, baked potatoes with olive oil, corn on the cob. No wheat, breads, sugars. And I took the Miralax everyday and got my gut healing and back in shape!
